TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Kerbal Planetary Base Systems v1.6.15 [28. April 2022]

Articles.Content:
On 11/20/2018 at 2:24 AM, Tonka Crash said:

I use the ground tether function in the USI Tools Mod with a patch to add it to all command pods. I've found this is more successful at keeping a base from moving around the ground than any attempt to anchor them to parts attached to the ground. If you have any USI mod you probably have the Tools installed as a dependency.

I use launch clamps :) (does have the problem of making your base an accident waiting (for a miss-pressed space bar) to happen).

2 hours ago, taniwha said:

I use launch clamps (does have the problem of making your base an accident waiting (for a miss-pressed space bar) to happen).

Sounds like one of those 'who would win' memes...

WHO WOULD WIN? THE INGENUITY OF A PLAYER OR ONE MISPRESSED SPACE BAR??
@Starwaster: I can tell you, the space bar won. Thus I have a solution under WIP (if you check some of my recent streams on twitch (taniwhaqf), you can see it).

What about the new KAS tether cables? They have some give, I'd imagine a handful for pylons and anchors would help to keep a moderately-sized flexibly immobile. 

The floating point error has always been a pain though, and it is terribly unfortunate that it has always been a major issue with multipart bases. I'm curious as to what it would take to fix.
I can't seem to find the greenhouse module. was it removed?

@Nils277 Just wanted to report a missing reference.  See <null> in the below pic.

Thanks for the great mod!

On 11/23/2018 at 9:46 AM, [email protected] said:

I can't seem to find the greenhouse module. was it removed?

It should be there, provided you are using a life support mod that would make use of it. I've run into several parts that are hidden in you don't have a mod that would need it.
Does this mod add supplies/fertilizer/mulch storage section that fit into the K&K Storage Sections?

3 hours ago, Solar_Ranger24 said:

Does this mod add supplies/fertilizer/mulch storage section that fit into the K&K Storage Sections?

Yes, They are among the wedge shaped containers for use in the modular storage parts.

13 hours ago, Tonka Crash said:

Yes, They are among the wedge shaped containers for use in the modular storage parts.

Thank you but I can't seem to find them even in sandbox mode, I am using the latest version by the way

Edited December 2, 2018 by Solar_Ranger24

6 hours ago, Solar_Ranger24 said:

Thank you but I can't seem to find them even in sandbox mode, I am using the latest version by the way

You do have USI-LS installed, don't you? It seems there are a lot of parts that only appear if you use a mod that makes use of them. It looks like the default folder in the VAB should be in Life Support tab with the USI-LS parts. I use CCK to stick all the modular storage parts in their own folder..

Did something get changed with the nuclear reactor? Recently I put one on a base and there wasn't even an option to turn it on like before. So it's just sitting there doing nothing. I didn't do anything different than any other time I've used it  and all other times I could turn it off and on at will.

If i use TAC is the greenhouse supposed to produce oxygen or only food?

edit: and if not is there any way to produce food,water,oxygen when landed on a different planet?

Hey,

I build a rocket and when I decoupled the Base Part I had no control over it. I tried the same build on the launchpad and it worked, but when I put it into orbit with the cheat console to test it I lost control again. It doenst matter if I have a kerbin the in the module or not, also Antennas dont seem to help.
Any suggestions?

The K&K storage (KIS) (both small and normal size) won't open for me inside the VAB.  Am I missing a mod?

18 hours ago, Joshuabmorgan said:

ive tried everything i know to do to get this mod to work. ive downloaded all the mods on the list and even got ksp v1.4.1 so some of the mods that haven't been updated yet would work but I still dont have any of the parts in this mod. and most of the other mods as well. is there an updated tutorial or something because im at a loss and dont know what I'm missing.

Many mods today rely on ModuleManager mod. I'd suggest you verifying that you have it in the game and it's of the compatible version.

8 hours ago, Rafael acevedo said:

take a snapshot of your gamedata folder.

https://imgur.com/a/mCBHw2S

2 hours ago, Joshuabmorgan said:

https://imgur.com/a/mCBHw2S

You have an incorrect install.  Do the following. 

1. Cut the zip files folders out of game data and paste to desktop

2. delete  Kerbal_planetary _base_system folder from game data

3. Right click on zipped Kerbal planetary based system folder 

4. Chose open (do not unzip)-window with contents of zip file will appear (you should see a game data folder and 7 text files)

5. double click on game data folder-window will open up with the 3 folders and 1 dll file (community category kit, community resource pack, and planetarybaseinc)

6. select and copy those 3 folders, not the dll

7. Paste those 3 folders into your KSP game data folder

8. it should now work

 

By looking at the game data folder picture some of the other MODS might be incorrectly installed too (you only have squad and squad expansion installed correctly).  I will recommend you take those out open them individually and only use what is inside the game data folder.

Do not touch the squad or squad expansion folders

You also have 3 different life support mods installed, pick one delete the rest or they will never work (will also affect kpbs)

 

Hope this helps 

Edited December 14, 2018 by Rafael acevedo
@Joshuabmorgan You might try CKAN. It's simpler to install mods.

32 minutes ago, Tonka Crash said:

@Joshuabmorgan You might try CKAN. It's simpler to install mods.

 

I agree, but learning to do it manually will always be an asset, specially for  those mods not ckan lister
